text: Boil the ribs and ginger in a pot. Once it starts to boil, skim off the "scum" from the top of the water. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to drain the ribs from the pot. Place the ribs on a plate covered with kitchen paper and drain it. Heat an oiled frying pan over a high heat. Add half of the ribs to the pan and brown them for a minute on each side. Repeat the process with the other half of the ribs. Drain the ribs again with kitchen paper.  Use another frying pan and add the soy sauce, chilli sauce, BBQ sauce, sherry, honey, sugar, 5 spice mix, and grated ginger. Stir everything together and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the ribs to the spice pan. Turn the ribs to coat them in the juice. Cook for 5 minutes until majority of the sauce has been absorbed, but be careful not to allow it to dry out completely. Transfer the ribs to a large serving plate. Spoon the remaining sauce over the ribs and sprinkle spring onions on the top. Finished.
